result.execSummary:
On one or more charges in this case, Nathan J. Wojtalewicz was found not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect. The defendant was found guilty of actually committing the crime(s) charged, but was also found not to be legally responsible under Wis. Stats. 971.165 for committing the crime(s) because of the defendant's mental condition. The legal effect of a finding of not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect is that the court must commit the defendant to the custody of the Department of Health and Family Services.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

1:31 p.m.  PM Defendant Nathan J. Wojtalewicz in court with Attorney (Atty) Maxwell Bergner. Defendant Nathan J. Wojtalewicz in custody. Prosecuting Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Brian Pfeil appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Alisha Johnson appears by video.

Court calls the case.
ADA Pfeil states the appearances.

ADA Pfeil indicates that the State had filed a Petition to Revoke the Defendant's Petition for Conditional Release.
Amended Report had been filed on May 18, 2021.
ADA Pfeil indicates that there is a stipulation amongst the parties and the state is relying on the report dated May 18, 2021 with regards to alternative housing.
Court has reviewed the report dated May 18, 2021.
Court finds that the proposed placement/plan is approrpriate.
ADA Pfeil states the alterantive housing for the defendant on the record.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds the subsequent order for placement/plan is appropriate and it is approved.
ADA Pfeil is to prepare an order for the court to e-sign.

Defendant Nathan J. Wojtalewicz in court with Attorney (Atty) Maxwell Bergner. Defendant Nathan J. Wojtalewicz in custody. Prosecuting Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Michael Daniel Zell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

1:31 PM Court calls case.
Matter is before the Court on the State's motion to revoke conditional release.
Atty Zell states appearances.

Atty Zell addresses the Court as to the status of the case.
There is an ongoing search for placement for Defendant. There is a possibility Defendant may be placed in a different placement.

Atty Bergner concurs, spoke with Alisha Johnson, should know shortly a couple possibilities, requests a brief adjournment.

Defendant is willing to waive the time limits.
Defendant would like to do this.
State has no objection.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds Defendant is freely, knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waiving time limits for this hearing.
There is just cause to adjourn the hearing to another date for reasons stated.

Defendant's mother is present. Atty Bergner addresses the Court, states that his client's mother offered Defendant to stay with his mother while making arrangements.
Court replies, would not be an appropriate placement at this point.

Defendant is in custody at the Portage County Jail.

1:35 PM Court is in recess.  Hearing scheduled for May 5, 2021 at 08:30 am.

10:02 a.m.  Defendant Nathan J. Wojtalewicz not in court. Prosecuting Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Michael Daniel Zell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Nathan J. Wojtalewicz appeared by video from Mendota.  Craig Jascor of ACC Community Connections appears in person.

Court calls the case and states the appearances.
Judge Baker appears in person (was previous counsel for the defendant and withdrew as counsel)
Court has received the report of Craig Jascor dated December 30, 2020.
Court questions the defendant if he wishes to proceed with the conditional release hearing.  He wishes to proceed without counsel today.
Court discusses, with the defendant, his constitutional rights and what an attorney can do on his behalf.
With everything as stated on the record by the Court.  The defendant wishes to proceed today without counsel.
Court questions a "typo" on page 3.  No objection by any party to have this typo corrected by the Court.
ADA Zell has reviewed the report and makes his statements on the record.
Defendant is in agreement with the report and the plan for his conditional release.

BY THE COURT
Defendant is proceeding freely, voluntarily, knowingly and intelligently with today's hearing without counsel.
Plan is adopted in its entirety and becomes a part of the Order.
Defendant is to report immediately after his release to the Department of Corrections, Division of Community Corrections located in Merrill.
Transport for the defendant is scheduled for 11 a.m. today.

1:51 p.m.  Exhibit #P1 is marked for ADA Mukoski.

01:54  p.m.  Defendant Nathan J. Wojtalewicz not in Court appeared via Zoom from Mendota Mental Health.   Attorney (Atty) Patricia A. Baker appeared in person.  Prosecuting Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Kristian Mukoski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Probation Agent, Sara Hohenstein, appeared via Zoom.   Social Worker, Aaron Hagedon, appeared via Zoom (Mendota Mental Health).  

Court calls the case.
ADA Mukoski states the appearances.
ADA Mukoski states that this is a conditional release hearing and will probably be contested.
1:57 p.m.  Dr Lundbohm is sworn in.
Direct examination by ADA Mukoski. 
2:01 p.m.  ADA Mukoski references Exhibit #P1.
ADA Mukoski moves Exhibit #P1 into evidence.  No objection by Atty Baker.  Received by the Court.
2:26 p.m.  Cross examination by Atty Baker.
2:43 p.m.  Witness testimony is complete and she is excused from the ZOOM Meeting.
State does not have any additional witnesses.
2:45 p.m.  Exhibit #D2 is marked for Atty Baker.
Dr Rawski is sworn in.
Direct examination by Atty Baker.
3:26 p.m.  ADA Mukoski has no questions on cross.
Court questions Dr Rawski.
3:30 p.m.  Witness is excused.
3:31 p.m.  Aaron Hagedon is sworn in.
Direct examination by Atty Baker.
3:34 p.m.  ADA Mukoski has no questions for this witness.
Witness is excused.
3:35 p.m.  ADA Mukoski gives final argument.
ADA Mukoski would ask that the court deny the defendant's request for conditional release.
3:37 p.m.  Atty Baker gives final argument.
Atty Baker would ask the court to issue the conditional release of the defendant.

BY THE COURT:
Conditional Release is GRANTED after an evaluation is done
Conditional Release Plan be developed and can identify the treatment/services to be received in the community
Responsible person's for treatment/services to be provided.
Plan to be provided within 60 days for approval and the evaluation to be completed while the defendant is in the institution

Defendant Nathan J. Wojtalewicz in court with Attorney (Atty) Patricia A. Baker. Defendant Nathan J. Wojtalewicz in custody. Prosecuting Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Kristian Mukoski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Exhibit #1 is marked on behalf of Plaintiff prior to the start of Court.

1:31 PM Court calls case.
This matter is before the Court on a petition to revoke conditional release.
Atty Mukoski states appearances.

Parties are ready to proceed.

1:32 PM Molly Roberts is called and sworn in.
Direct examination by Atty Mukoski.
Witness identifies Defendant.
Exhibit #1 is referred to.
BY THE COURT: Exhibit #1 is admitted.
Atty Baker states objection.
State replies.
Atty Baker gives short rebuttle.
Court reviews the interpretation.
BY THE COURT: Court will consider entire performance of Defendant while on conditional release as this is the first conditional release revocation since he was placed most recently on his plan. Objection is overruled.
Direct examination continues.
1:55 PM Cross-examination by Atty Baker.
Exhibit #2 is marked on behalf of Defense, is referred to.

2:27 PM Brooke Klawitter is called and sworn in.
Direct examination by Atty Mukoski.
2:35 PM Cross-examination by Atty Baker.

2:43 PM McKenzie Turner is called and sworn in.
Direct examination by Atty Mukoski.

State has no further witnesses.

2:48 PM Sara Hohenstein is called and sworn in.
Direct examination by Atty Baker.
2:51 PM Examination by the Court.
2:54 PM Re-direct by Atty Baker.

2:55 PM Margaret Wojtalewicz is called and sworn in.
Direct examination by Atty Baker.
2:58 PM Cross-examination by Atty Mukoski.

Atty Baker has no further witnesses.

Atty Mukoski addresses the Court, gives final arguments.
Atty Baker addresses the Court, gives final arguments.

Court has a number of factors to consider.
Court finds Defendant violated the rules as stated on the record.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds State met its burden by clear and convincing evidence that Defendant has violated a number of rules and conditions of his release.

Defendant addresses the Court.
Court advises Defendant he cannot petition for 6 months.

BY THE COURT:
Court revokes conditional release at this time.
Court commends the work that Defendant has had done. 
Defendant is remanded to the custody of the Sheriff.

All exhibits are accounted for. 

3:10 PM Court is in recess.

Defendant Nathan J. Wojtalewicz in court with attorney Patricia A. Baker.   Defendant Nathan J. Wojtalewicz in custody.  Prosecuting Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Kristian Mukoski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

1:44 p.m.  Case is called and appearances are stated.

Atty Mukoski states that the conditional release plan has "fallen" apart.
Defendant's case manager, Molly, explains the reasons on the record.
Court questions if there is a time table as to where Nathan may be placed; case manager responds.
Court asks further questions; case manager responds on the record.
Atty Baker makes statements.  
Hearing is to be re-scheduled.
Atty Baker needed to see if Atty Boden would  be able to cover for her in her absence; he will be able to cover.

BY THE COURT:
Court cannot approve a plan that has fallen through at the last minute.
Court apologizes to the defendant for the issue that has occured.
Defendant will be returned to Winnebago Mental Health until the next hearing.

Psychological Evaluation/Conditional Release prepared by Kent M Berney, Ph.D.
Hearing on August 9, 2018 at 01:30 pm.

3:04 p.m. case is called.  
Defendant Nathan J. Wojtalewicz via video from Winnebago Mental Health Institution with attorney Patricia A. Baker in court. Louis John Molepske (DA) appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court has received the report of Dr. Berney who did the evaluation and received correspondence from Dept of Health services outlining the defendant's progress at Winnebago Mental Health
Both parties have received copies.
Attorney Baker has went over the documentation with the defendant.
Attorney Molepske makes a statement to the court and does not object to the plan set forth. 
Attorney Baker requests the court to release her client.
The parties stipulate to the court.

BY THE COURT:
The court has reviewed the report and correspondence from DHS and the court reviewed the records and heard comment of counsel, court finds the defendant was committed to the Department of Health Serives on 3/29/16.  On 6/5/18, court upon reviewing report of Dr. Berney, determined that the defendant is appropriate for that conditional release given certain conditions, based on that the opinion, conditional release would not pose a significant risk either of bodily harm to the defendant or to others, or of serious property damage.
The defendant resides in Portage County.  
The court orders:
DHS and the 51.42 Board of the County prepare a plan that identifies the treatment and services, if any that the defendant will receive in the community; the defendant's needs, if any, for supervision, medication, community support services, residential services, vocational services, and alcohol or other drug abuse treatment; who will be responsible for providing the treatment and services identified in the plan.
The Court further orders all of defendant's treatment records requested by DHS be released to DHS.
The plan be presented to court for approval within 60 days for defendant who is in an institution under this commitment.  
The hearing be held on August 9, 2018 at 1:30 p.m.

Atty Baker requests a writ from the State.  Attorney Molepske will prepare the writ.
3:11 p.m.  hearing is concluded.  
Hearing scheduled for August 9, 2018 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Nathan J. Wojtalewicz appearaed by video from Winnebago Mental Health and attorney David Paul Frank Templeton appeared in Court . Defendant Nathan J. Wojtalewicz in custody. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Hearing on supervised release revocation hearing.

11:00 a.m.  Court calls case.
Atty Knaapen states the appearances.
Parties are ready to proceed.
Atty Templeton states his client is objecting to the revocation hearing.
11:02 a.m.  Stephany Tatro (probation & parole) is sworn in.
Direct examination by Atty Knaapen
11:05 a.m.  Cross examination by Atty Templeton.
11:10 a.m.  Re-direct by Atty Knaapen.
11:11 a.m.  Re-cross by Atty Templeton.
Atty Knaapen has nothing further.
Court questions the witness.
11:12 a.m.  Witness is excused.
Mark Malcore is sworn in.
Direct examination by Atty Knaapen.
11:29 a.m.  Cross examination by Atty Templeton.
11:32 a.m.  Witness is excused.
State rests.
Atty Templeton has no witnesses to call.
Atty Knaapen gives his argument on the revocation of the conditional release of the defendant.
11:35 a.m.  Atty Templeton gives his argument on the revocation of the conditional release of the defendant.

BY THE COURT:
Court REVOKES the conditional release that the defendant is under.
**Defendant will be allowed to petition the Court every 6 months for conditional release.

Atty Templeton indicates he would request that the defendant remain at Winnebago Mental Health but this is to be determined by the Department of Health and Human Services.
Atty David Templeton appointed

Defendant Nathan J. Wojtalewicz in court with attorney Acalia N Halverson. Defendant Nathan J. Wojtalewicz in custody. ADA Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Conditional Release Plan authors Behavorial Consultants Malcore and Tatrow are present. State informs the Court the status of the this case and is requesting 10 yr comittment. Status conference on May 16, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Nathan J. Wojtalewicz in court with attorney Acalia N Halverson. Defendant Nathan J. Wojtalewicz in custody. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

2:24 p.m.  Court is in session.
Atty Knaapen states the appearances.
Court requests the status of this  case.
Atty Knaapen provides status of case; conditional release of defendant into the community.
Court makes statements regarding a conditional release plan - this is to be completed by the Department of Health Services.
Atty Knaapen indicates that he has received reports in the past with specific recommendations/conditions for the conditional release plan.
Atty Knaapen indicates that there are not specific recommendations stated in Mr Melcore's report.
Atty Halverson makes statements in regards to the client's conditional release.
Court makes statement that the release is done prior to the plan being completed.
Court questions Mr Melcore - Mr Melcore responds.
Atty Knaapen makes additional statements regarding the plan.
Defendant makes statements on his behalf.
Court indicates that they may be looking at a bond modification request.
Atty Halverson makes statements.
Court makes statements regarding the standard order form and that the plan needs to be approved before the conditional release can be done.
Atty Halverson makes additional comments regarding the conditional release plan.
Court asks Atty Halverson if she is requesting a bond modification; Atty Halverson responds.
Atty Knaapen makes further statements.
Court questions Mr Melcore - Mr Melcore responds.
Court will address the conditional release prior to the bond modification - parties stipulate to the conditional release.
Court makes further statements.
Atty Halverson makes a statement regarding the next Court hearing.
Court questions Mr Melcore - Mr Melcore indicates one week would be sufficient.

BY THE COURT:
Conditional Relase of the defendant would not pose a significant risk to himself or the rest of the community.
Department of Health Services to provide a plan regarding the conditional release and states the specifics on the record.
Defendants records to be released to DHS.
Order to be provided within 21 days.
Motion to Modify Bond is DENIED.  Status conference scheduled for May 16, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
Purchase Order /s/ TBE 04/04/16 - Payment to Behavioral Consultants in the amount of $1,500

Order for Commitment (Not Guilty by Reason of Mental Disease or Defect) /s/ TBE 03/28/16

Status conference on May 4, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Nathan J. Wojtalewicz in court with attorney Acalia N Halverson. Defendant Nathan J. Wojtalewicz in custody. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

10:59 AM Court calls case.
Atty Knaapen states appearances.

Matter is set for a status conference. There was an NGI plea entered. Court has received a copy of the doctor's report and provided copies to the parties.  
Atty Knaapen has received its copy.
Defense has received their copy.

Atty Knaapen addresses the Court, anticipates Defendant to enter the plea of NGI.
Atty Knaapen will be requesting additional examinations and further hearings.

Court addresses the parties, has reviewed statute.

Defendant concurs. 
Defendant addresses the Court.  

Court has reviewed the complaint that was filed in this matter.

There are two parts to this matter, Court explains.

Court has received the plea questionnaire/waiver of rights.
Defendant has signed the document as Jesus Christ.
Defendant understood the document.

Court questions Defendant.
Defendant has read and understood the examination. 

Defendant understands what he is pleading to.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court informs Defendant of charges and penalties.

Defendant enters a plea of: GUILTY to this first phase, but still maintaining NGI.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.

Court questions Attorney Halverson for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Both attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge.
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
Defendant qualifies for the repeater allegation.
Count 1: Finds Guilty 

Responsibility phase:
State having received their copy of evaluation, is not in a position to contradict. 
Atty Halverson is in agreement.
Defendant concurs.

Court has reviewed the evaluation from the doctor.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds Defendant Not Guilty by Reason of Mental Disease or Defect for reasons stated in the examination.

State requests the predispositional report from Department of Health Services.
Atty Halverson believes the additional supplemental is not necessary, requests a treatment plan be put in place asap.

BY THE COURT:
Court will order a predisposition examination. 
Court will commit Defendant to Department of Health Services and Court will order predispositional report to be created by Department of Health Services and prepare a report for placement.
All Defendant's treatment records requested by the investigator are to be released to investigator.

941.29 is addressed by the Court.
Defendant addresses the Court regarding firearms.

941.291 is addressed by the Court.

BY THE COURT: 
Court orders the evaluation report to be furnished to the Court no later than April 26th.

11:28 AM Hearing is concluded.

  Status conference scheduled for May 4, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Nathan J. Wojtalewicz in court with attorney Acalia N Halverson. Defendant Nathan J. Wojtalewicz in custody. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
3:28 p.m. case is called and appearance stated on the record.
This is a preliminary hearing. 
Defendant waives right to Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions the Defendant regarding Waiver of Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions Defendant's attorney.
Court finds the Defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the Preliminary Hearing.
Based on the response and the attorney's representations,  defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 
State files Information.
Defendant's attorney received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information - does mirror the complaint.

The defendant filed an Order based on 971.16
Attorney enters a plea of NG by Mental disease
Attorney requests a modification of bond to a signature bond so he can seek treatment at Norwood.  
ADA Knaapen informs the court that the county has a contract of the doctors typically appointed to handle this evaluation.  
The evaluation need to be completed within 30 days.  

ADA Knaapen makes statement as to position of cash bond.  Attorney Halverson makes statement re: position of modification of bond.

Court would certainly sign a stipulation if there is one between the parties.  
Defendant makes statement to the court.
Court sets a hearing to determine NGI - March 7, 2016 at 10:30 a.m.  

Bond Continued.
